item.title: Jio BlackRock Sees India Mutual Fund Industry Tripling by 2032
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- BlackRock Inc.’s India venture with billionaire Mukesh Ambani’s group expects the nearly $900 billion local mutual fund industry to expand up to threefold over the next seven years, fueled by record inflows from domestic investors and a robust economy. item.title: Finanzaufsicht rügt zwei PSD Banken

item.title: Vorsicht bei diesen ETF-Trends!
item.author: Handelsblatt
item.description: Was einst als Nischenprodukt für institutionelle Investoren begann, hat sich zum Liebling der Privatanleger entwickelt. Millionen Deutsche investieren inzwischen regelmäßig in börsengehandelte Indexfonds, ETFs. Der Erfolg der ETFs bei Kleinanlegern erklärt sich durch ihre geringen Kosten, ihre Trans...

item.title: „Eine Art künstlicher Warren Buffett“

item.description: Eric Endress ist Head of Quantitative Research beim Fondshaus Acatis. Im Interview spricht er darüber, welche Aufgaben KI im Asset-Management übernimmt – und wo ihre Möglichkeiten enden. Herr Endress, was kann KI im Asset-Management leisten? item.title: ECB’s Kazaks and Simkus Sees No Reason to Cut Rates for Now
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- European Central Bank Governing Council members Martins Kazaks and Gediminas Simkus said interest rates don’t need to be cut further right now, though neither of them ruled out an eventual move. “At the current moment, inflation is around 2%, economic growth is I’d say weak,” Kazaks, ...

item.title: Smartphone Maker Nothing Raises $200 Million to Build AI Devices
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Nothing Technologies Ltd., a smartphone maker founded just five years ago, has raised $200 million to try and develop the next generation of AI-native devices. The Series C financing round was led by Tiger Global, with support from existing backers GV, Highland Europe, EQT, Latitude, ...

item.title: ECB Must Remain Agile Due to Lingering Uncertainty, Escriva Says
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- The European Central Bank must stand ready to act on interest rates, with uncertainty persisting despite inflation being under control, Governing Council member Jose luis Escriva said. “We need to be very agile and ready to move in any direction on monetary policy,” the Spanish centra...

item.title: BlackRock, Janus Among Managers to Lose Dutch Credit Mandate
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- BlackRock Inc. is among a group of money managers to have lost credit mandates from one of Europe’s largest pension funds, according to people familiar with the matter. PFZW, a €250 billion ($295 billion) sustainability-focused pension fund in the Netherlands, has removed BlackRock an...

item.title: UK Jobs Data Boost Economist Calls That BOE Rate Cuts Are Done
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- A growing number of economists believe the Bank of England has finished cutting interest rates as policymakers struggle to contain a fresh spike in inflation, a sentiment likely bolstered by fresh jobs data. item.title: Longtime BlackRock Muni Exec O’Connor to Retire in 2026
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Walter O’Connor, who has worked in municipal bonds for four decades, is retiring from BlackRock Inc. next year. O’Connor serves as the co-head of the municipal funds team within BlackRock’s municipal fixed income business. He’s a portfolio manager on funds like BlackRock’s $6 billion ...
